negotiator.xml.multipartyrunner

Class ProgressReporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • negotiator.xml.multipartyrunner.ProgressReporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Listener<NegotiationEvent>

    public class ProgressReporter
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Listener<NegotiationEvent>
    Object that listens to NegotiationEvents and increases it's internal counter on each event. It will run in a separate thread and report progress to the System.out channel (Console by default).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgressReporter

        public ProgressReporter(int numNegotiations)
        Initialize a new instance of the ProgressReporter class.
        Parameters:
        numNegotiations - The total amount of negotiations to do. Progress will increase up to this number.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Report progress to the System.out channel. This might run indefinitely so caller should take care of an interrupt request when they are done with reporting progress. For timing to be correct, this should be called as late as possible, but just before the actual negotiation runner starts. N.B. This is an implementation of thread main loop. Call by using the .start() method from an instantiated ProgressReporter
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Called when done with reporting progress. This will stop the thread. Also this will clean up any progress report that is still on the command line and print the done message. For timing to be correct, this should be called as soon as possible after negotiation is finished.
        Overrides:
        interrupt in class java.lang.Thread

      • notifyChange

        public void notifyChange(NegotiationEvent data)
        Increase progress counter when negotiation event comes in. a notification call that occurs when something changed. Consult the parent object for details about this event.

        NOTICE 1

        notifications run in the thread of the caller. The caller will be blocked until this callback has been completed. It is therfore good practice to handle callbacks quickly.

        NOTICE 2

        Notifications often cross a thread sarety boundary. For example when in MVC a model (typically thread safe) calls back a panel (not thread safe). The called side (the panel) thus must handle the callback in a thread safe manner, e.g. using SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable). We recommend to avoid synchronize as this will can block indefinitely (see notice 1) which might lead to deadlocks.
        Specified by:
        notifyChange in interface Listener<NegotiationEvent>
        Parameters:
        data - additional data, typically the new value associated with the event
